hero.name: Alejandro Repetto
hero.title: Software Engineer
hero.description:
I'm obsessed with reducing complexity. I build fast, ship faster, and I don't sleep until every test passes.
Awarded at NASA Space Apps, ETH Argentina, and ETH Global.

bio.short: I'm a Systems Engineering student and a nerd who loves solving problems. I found in software my holy grail for doing it. I'm very good at automating tasks that used to take countless hours and entire teams, doing it scalably, efficiently and securely, driven by my passion for competitive programming and cybersecurity. Above all, I'm curious and love a good challenge.

background.title: Background
background.text:
I've been programming seriously since 2022, when I placed 6th in my first ICPC tournament. A 2024 winter training camp was a turning point that transformed how I approach technical challenges.

My projects range from NASA Space Apps prediction algorithms to production systems with RAG architectures.

approach.title: Approach
approach.text: I'm very pragmatic. Competitive programming trained me to always analyze the time and space complexity of my projects, but the multiple hackathons I competed in taught me to build and validate MVPs fast, without losing sight of the architecture and distributed systems design that engineering gave me.

skills.title: Skills & Technologies
skills.subtitle: A complete toolkit for building full applications, from modern web systems to AI-powered automations.

projects.title: Featured Projects
projects.description: A collection of engineering projects spanning management systems, automation, and applied AI/ML built to solve real-world challenges.
